verses.kjv: There is therefore now no condemnation to them which are in Christ Jesus, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit.
verses.ct: So now there is no condemnation for those who belong to Christ Jesus, who live not according to their sinful nature but according to the Spirit.

verses.kjv: For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus hath made me free from the law of sin and death.
verses.ct: Because the principle of the Spirit — who gives life through Christ Jesus — has set me free from the principle of sin and death.

verses.kjv: For what the law could not do, in that it was weak through the flesh, God sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh, and for sin, condemned sin in the flesh:
verses.ct: The law was unable to accomplish this because human weakness made it powerless. So God sent his own Son in a body like our sinful bodies, and as an offering for sin, he condemned sin right there in human flesh.

verses.kjv: That the righteousness of the law might be fulfilled in us, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit.
verses.ct: He did this so that the righteous requirements of the law could be fully met in us — those who live not according to our sinful nature but according to the Spirit.

verses.kjv: For they that are after the flesh do mind the things of the flesh; but they that are after the Spirit the things of the Spirit.
verses.ct: People who are controlled by their sinful nature focus on what that nature desires, but people who are controlled by the Spirit focus on what the Spirit desires.

verses.kjv: For to be carnally minded is death; but to be spiritually minded is life and peace.
verses.ct: Letting your sinful nature control your thinking leads to death, but letting the Spirit control your thinking leads to life and peace.

verses.kjv: Because the carnal mind is enmity against God: for it is not subject to the law of God, neither indeed can be.
verses.ct: The mindset of the sinful nature is hostile toward God. It refuses to submit to God's law, and truthfully, it can't.

verses.kjv: So then they that are in the flesh cannot please God.
verses.ct: Those who are controlled by their sinful nature are unable to please God.

verses.kjv: But ye are not in the flesh, but in the Spirit, if so be that the Spirit of God dwell in you. Now if any man have not the Spirit of Christ, he is none of his.
verses.ct: But you are not controlled by your sinful nature — you are controlled by the Spirit, since the Spirit of God lives in you. If someone doesn't have the Spirit of Christ, that person doesn't belong to him.

verses.kjv: And if Christ be in you, the body is dead because of sin; but the Spirit is life because of righteousness.
verses.ct: But if Christ is in you, then even though your body is subject to death because of sin, the Spirit gives you life because of righteousness.

verses.kjv: But if the Spirit of him that raised up Jesus from the dead dwell in you, he that raised up Christ from the dead shall also quicken your mortal bodies by his Spirit that dwelleth in you.
verses.ct: If the Spirit of the one who raised Jesus from the dead lives in you, then the one who raised Christ from the dead will also give life to your mortal bodies through his Spirit living in you.

verses.kjv: Therefore, brethren, we are debtors, not to the flesh, to live after the flesh.
verses.ct: So then, brothers and sisters, we have an obligation — but it is not to our sinful nature, to live according to it.

verses.kjv: For if ye live after the flesh, ye shall die: but if ye through the Spirit do mortify the deeds of the body, ye shall live.
verses.ct: If you live according to your sinful nature, you will die. But if through the Spirit you put to death the sinful actions of the body, you will live.

verses.kjv: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, they are the sons of God.
verses.ct: Everyone who is led by the Spirit of God is a child of God.

verses.kjv: For ye have not received the spirit of bondage again to fear; but ye have received the Spirit of adoption, whereby we cry, Abba, Father.
verses.ct: The Spirit you received does not make you slaves living in fear again. Instead, the Spirit you received makes you adopted children, and by him we cry out, "Abba, Father!"

verses.kjv: The Spirit itself beareth witness with our spirit, that we are the children of God:
verses.ct: The Spirit himself confirms to our spirit that we are God's children.

verses.kjv: And if children, then heirs; heirs of God, and joint-heirs with Christ; if so be that we suffer with him, that we may be also glorified together.
verses.ct: And if we are children, then we are heirs — heirs of God and co-heirs with Christ — as long as we share in his suffering so that we may also share in his glory.

verses.kjv: For I reckon that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the glory which shall be revealed in us.
verses.ct: I am convinced that what we suffer in this present time doesn't even compare to the glory that will be revealed in us.

verses.kjv: For the earnest expectation of the creature waiteth for the manifestation of the sons of God.
verses.ct: All of creation waits with eager longing for the revealing of God's children.

verses.kjv: For the creature was made subject to vanity, not willingly, but by reason of him who hath subjected the same in hope,
verses.ct: Creation was subjected to frustration — not by its own choice, but by the will of the one who subjected it — yet with hope,

verses.kjv: Because the creature itself also shall be delivered from the bondage of corruption into the glorious liberty of the children of God.
verses.ct: because creation itself will be liberated from its slavery to decay and brought into the glorious freedom that belongs to God's children.

verses.kjv: For we know that the whole creation groaneth and travaileth in pain together until now.
verses.ct: We know that all of creation has been groaning together, like a woman in labor, right up to the present moment.

verses.kjv: And not only they, but ourselves also, which have the firstfruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves groan within ourselves, waiting for the adoption, to wit, the redemption of our body.
verses.ct: Not only creation, but we ourselves — who have the Spirit as a first installment of what's to come — we also groan inwardly as we wait eagerly for our full adoption, that is, the redemption of our bodies.

verses.kjv: For we are saved by hope: but hope that is seen is not hope: for what a man seeth, why doth he yet hope for?
verses.ct: We were saved with this hope in view. But hope that you can already see fulfilled isn't really hope — after all, who hopes for something they already have?

verses.kjv: But if we hope for that we see not, then do we with patience wait for it.
verses.ct: But if we hope for what we don't yet see, we wait for it with patience.

verses.kjv: Likewise the Spirit also helpeth our infirmities: for we know not what we should pray for as we ought: but the Spirit itself maketh intercession for us with groanings which cannot be uttered.
verses.ct: In the same way, the Spirit helps us in our weakness. We don't know how to pray as we should, but the Spirit himself intercedes for us with groans too deep for words.

verses.kjv: And he that searcheth the hearts knoweth what is the mind of the Spirit, because he maketh intercession for the saints according to the will of God.
verses.ct: And God, who examines every heart, understands what the Spirit intends, because the Spirit intercedes for God's people in perfect alignment with God's will.

verses.kjv: And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God, to them who are the called according to his purpose.
verses.ct: We know that God causes everything to work together for the good of those who love him — those who have been called according to his purpose.

verses.kjv: For whom he did foreknow, he also did predestinate to be conformed to the image of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among many brethren.
verses.ct: Those God knew in advance, he also chose ahead of time to be shaped into the likeness of his Son, so that his Son would be the firstborn among many brothers and sisters.

verses.kjv: Moreover whom he did predestinate, them he also called: and whom he called, them he also justified: and whom he justified, them he also glorified.
verses.ct: And those he chose ahead of time, he also called. Those he called, he also declared righteous. And those he declared righteous, he also glorified.

verses.kjv: What shall we then say to these things? If God be for us, who can be against us?
verses.ct: So what should we say about all of this? If God is on our side, who could possibly stand against us?

verses.kjv: He that spared not his own Son, but delivered him up for us all, how shall he not with him also freely give us all things?
verses.ct: Since he didn't hold back his own Son but gave him up for all of us, won't he also generously give us everything else along with him?

verses.kjv: Who shall lay any thing to the charge of God’s elect? It is God that justifieth.
verses.ct: Who can bring an accusation against the people God has chosen? God himself is the one who declares them righteous.

verses.kjv: Who is he that condemneth? It is Christ that died, yea rather, that is risen again, who is even at the right hand of God, who also maketh intercession for us.
verses.ct: Who is the one who will condemn? Christ Jesus is the one who died — and more than that, who was raised to life — and who is now at God's right hand, actively interceding for us.

verses.kjv: Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? shall tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword?
verses.ct: What can separate us from Christ's love? Can trouble, hardship, persecution, hunger, poverty, danger, or violence?

verses.kjv: As it is written, For thy sake we are killed all the day long; we are accounted as sheep for the slaughter.
verses.ct: As Scripture says, "Because of you we face death all day long; we are treated like sheep waiting to be slaughtered."

verses.kjv: Nay, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him that loved us.
verses.ct: No — in all these things we are more than conquerors through the one who loved us.

verses.kjv: For I am persuaded, that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor powers, nor things present, nor things to come,
verses.ct: I am absolutely certain that neither death nor life, neither angels nor rulers, neither present realities nor future events, neither any powers,

verses.kjv: Nor height, nor depth, nor any other creature, shall be able to separate us from the love of God, which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.
verses.ct: neither the heights above nor the depths below — nothing in all of creation — will be able to separate us from God's love that is found in Christ Jesus our Lord.
